intro: Melica persica subsp. schischkinii, commonly known as Persian vernal grass, is a perennial grass species native to Central Asia. It typically grows in moist meadows and mountainous regions, preferring temperate climates. The plant features slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves, with small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and its tolerance to moderate frost. Botanically, it is notable for its genetic distinctiveness within the genus Melica.
